DOC.brief_title: Continuous Noninvasive Method Estimating Predicting Maternal Fetal Hemodynamic Changes During Regional Anesthesia
DOC.detailed_description: Specific aim : 1 . Collect noninvasive physiological waveform data patient undergoing regional anesthesia labor fetal intervention University Colorado Hospital Children 's Hospital Colorado . 2 . Combine physiological data patient monitor clinical demographic data , include maternal problem list , medication , volume infuse , use vasopressor , arterial venous pressure , fetal heart rate , fetal umbilical artery Doppler velocimetry , maternal uterine artery Doppler waveform , fetal neonatal outcome etc . use develop mathematical model early detection maternal functional hypovolemia . 3 . Develop robust , real-time , computational model : - estimate maternal volume status prior administration epidural anesthesia - estimate effective intravascular volume loss maternal regional anesthesia - predicting optimal , individual specific requirement IV resuscitation and/or need vasopressor agent provide adequate analgesia use regional technique optimize fetal outcome - identify mother susceptible epidural induce hypotension
DOC.criteria: 1 . Age : 14 44 year 2 . Pregnant 3 . Undergoing regional anesthesia labor fetal intervention University Colorado Hospital Children 's Hospital Colorado 1 . Severe preeclampsia/eclampsia 2 . Preprocedural maternal hypertension require treatment 3 . Significant fetal heart rate abnormality prior regional anesthesia 4 . Incarcerated 5 .
